title: ML: Understanding Regression Coefficients
story: Coefficients tell you feature importance and direction. A coefficient of 5 means: increase feature by 1, prediction increases by 5.
instructions: Given coefficients [3, -2] and intercept 10, predict for input [4, 5]. Formula: y = coef[0]*x[0] + coef[1]*x[1] + intercept. Print the prediction.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

coef = np.array([3, -2])
intercept = 10
x = np.array([4, 5])

# Multiple linear regression
y_pred = np.dot(coef, x) + intercept

print(y_pred)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

coef = np.array([3, -2])
intercept = 10
x = np.array([4, 5])

y_pred = np.dot(coef, x) + intercept

print(y_pred)

hints.text: Use np.dot(coef, x) to compute weighted sum, then add intercept.
